text: Humans have been using boomerangs for at least 20,000 years.

Boomerangs have two wings that connect at an angle and they're each shaped just like an airplane's wing

they have a rounder blunter edge, called a leading edge and a sharp tapered edge, called a trailing edge

When air strikes an airfoil, it goes over the leading edge and pushes downwards off the trailing edge
creating a downwards force of air
since every action has an equal and opposite reaction, this downward force of air off the wing
